function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Inadequate building stock that cannot be economically replaced or upgraded due to cultural reasons","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Behavior patterns of individuals unwilling to conform with public health requirements","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Pivot to virtual delivery of education, experiences, and commerce","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Infections caused by design constraints and ventilation issues in quarantine buildings","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"System failure leading to seeding events into the community","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate urban sewer systems for early detection of virus fragments in wastewater","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Failure to contain new strains of sars-cov-2","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Infection spread within quarantine facilities","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Regulated customer numbers in shops may lead to long queues outside, increasing the risk of close contact and transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Narrow supermarket aisles make it difficult for shoppers to maintain social distancing, increasing the risk of infection while passing in the aisles.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of infection in public transport due to limited air circulation and seating density, leading to prolonged exposure in confined environments.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High turn-over and customer density models in stores and hospitality venues","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Personal agency leading to variable levels of social distancing compliance","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased uptake of drive-through and online ordering services","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Risk of covid-19 spread in open-plan offices and linear desk arrangements","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of contagion in enclosed communal circulation spaces","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of stay-at-home orders on mental health and vulnerability","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Closure of small neighborhood parks impacting mental health","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Workplace transmission of sars-cov-2 leading to household and community spread","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Socio-economic disparities and vulnerability to infection","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Architectural design issues contributing to household infections","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Failure of stay-at-home orders to effectively curb community transmission of covid-19 due to permeability and abuse","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Emergence of new strains of sars-cov-2, such as omicron, posing new challenges and being more infectious","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Community resistance to vaccination","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of grant funding for research","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Contagious disease transmission in smart working environments","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate supervision in partial smart working","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Association between indoor and outdoor green features and self-reported change in psychological outcomes related to the covid-19 lockdown","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Need for further investigation into the definition and significance of indoor greenery for human health and well-being","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Investigation of the therapeutic benefits of indoor horticultural activities for individuals at risk, such as those with age-related diseases","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exclusion of less wealthy population due to internet access bias","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Exclusion of elderly population due to digital divide","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on self-reported and brief web-based surveys","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Non-representative sample due to geographic and demographic imbalance","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Self-selection bias in online survey due to technology use","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of internationally validated measuring instruments for psychological health outcomes","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of green features in the home environment may lead to a decline in psychological health during covid-19 lockdown.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited access to public green spaces during the covid-19 pandemic may impact psychological health.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate interaction with green elements in the workplace may affect psychological health, especially for non-smart workers.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Association between indoor-outdoor green features and psychological health outcomes adjusted for covid-19 cases.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Effects of lockdown on individuals’ perception and behavioral adjustment.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Differential effects of indoor and outdoor green features on psychological health outcomes.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Interaction of current working mode and green view affecting psychological health outcomes.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inconsistent evidence on the effects of outdoor green spaces on psychological and mental health","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited studies on the effect of green spaces on mental health when access to public residential green spaces is not allowed","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases in built environments due to close proximity of individuals","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Incomplete or unclear data on the prevalence of psychological health outcomes.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Potential bias in the study participants’ reporting of psychological health outcomes.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Risk of misinterpretation of the descriptive statistics of psychological health outcomes.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases through indoor plants and green spaces","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"}]}
